tit.j: 京都府立陶板名画の庭

sen.j: 京都府立陶板名画の庭（きょうとふりつとうばんめいがのにわ）は京都市左京区下鴨にあり古今の名画を陶器の板に転写して展示している屋外美術館である。
sen.e: Located in Shimogamo, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Garden of Fine Art, Kyoto is an outdoor art museum exhibiting ceramic plates on which great pictures of all ages are copied.
Located in Shimogamo, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Garden of Fine Art, Kyoto is an outdoor art museum exhibiting ceramic plates on which great pictures of all ages are copied.
Garden of Fine Art, Kyoto is an outdoor art museum exhibiting ceramic plates on which great pictures of all ages are copied, located in Shimogamo, Sakyo-ku Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 陶板画は原画を撮影したポジフィルムを元に写真製版技術により陶製の板に転写し焼成したものである。
sen.e: Based on a positive film on which an original picture has been photographed, its porcelain panel painting version is generated by copying the photograph on a ceramic plate using a photo-engraving technique and by baking the plate.

Based on a positive film on which an original picture has been photographed, its porcelain panel painted version is generated by copying the photograph onto a ceramic plate using a photo-engraving technique and then by baking the plate.

Based on a positive film on which an original picture has been photographed, its porcelain panel painted version is generated by copying the photograph onto a ceramic plate using a photo-engraving technique and then by baking the plate.

sen.j: その性質上変色や腐食が起こらないので屋外にあっても永く保存することが可能である。
sen.e: From the nature of the plate material, the copied painting do not discolor nor is eroded, making it possible to keep it for a long period of time.
From the nature of the plate material, the copied painting does not discolor nor does it erode, making it possible to keep it for a long period of time.
From the nature of the plate material, the copied painting does not discolor nor does it erode, making it possible to keep it for a long period of time.

sen.j: どの絵も複数の陶板で構成されている。
sen.e: Any of the pictures is made of more than one ceramic plate.
The pictures are made on more than one ceramic plate.
The pictures are made on more than one ceramic plate.

sen.j: この種の美術展示施設としては世界初のものである。
sen.e: The museum is the first in the world as the art-exhibiting facilities of this kind.
The museum is the first in the world as an art-exhibiting facilities of this kind.
The museum is the first in the world as an art-exhibiting facilities of this kind.

sen.j: 展示されている絵画は世界の名画8点が選ばれていおり、内4点は元々1990年の国際花と緑の博覧会の為に制作され、安藤忠雄の設計によるパヴィリオン『名画の庭』に展示されていた。
sen.e: Eight great pictures in the world are selected and exhibited there, of which four were originally created for The International Garden and Greenery Exposition, Osaka, Japan, 1990 and were exhibited in the "Garden of Fine Art" pavilion" designed by Tadao ANDO.

Eight great worldly renown pictures are selected and exhibited there, of which four were originally created for The International Garden and Greenery Exposition, Osaka, Japan, in 1990 and were exhibited in the "Garden of Fine Art" pavilion" designed by Tadao ANDO.

Eight great worldly renown pictures are selected and exhibited there, of which four were originally created for The International Garden and Greenery Exposition, Osaka, Japan, in 1990 and were exhibited in the "Garden of Fine Art" pavilion designed by Tadao ANDO.
sen.cmt: 余分なクォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 残り4点はこの施設の為に作られたものである。
sen.e: The remaining four were created for this facility.
The remaining four were created for this facility.
The remaining four were created for this facility.

sen.j: 制作は大塚オーミ陶業株式会社の信楽工場で行われた。
sen.e: The porcelain panel versions of the paintings were made at the Sigaki factory of Otsuka Ohmi Ceramics Co.,Ltd.
The porcelain panel versions of the paintings were made at the Sigaki factory of Otsuka Ohmi Ceramics Co.,Ltd.
The porcelain panel versions of the paintings were made at the Sigaraki factory of Otsuka Ohmi Ceramics Co., Ltd.

sen.j: これらの陶板画は堺屋太一の企画発案により所有者であったダイコク電機取締役、栢森新治より京都府に寄贈されたもの。
sen.e: These porcelain panel paintings, originally owned by Shinji KAYAMORI, a director of Daikoku Denki, were donated by KAYAMORI to Kyoto Prefecture based on a plan and proposal of Taichi SAKAIYA.
These porcelain panel paintings, originally owned by Shinji KAYAMORI, a director of Daikoku Denki, were donated by KAYAMORI to Kyoto Prefecture based on a plan and proposal of Taichi SAKAIYA.
These porcelain panel paintings, originally owned by Shinji KAYAMORI, a director of Daikoku Denki, were donated by Kayamori to Kyoto Prefecture based on a plan and proposal of Taichi SAKAIYA.

sen.j: オープンエアの建物は安藤忠雄の設計により平成6年（1994年）3月に完成した。
sen.e: The construction of the open air facility based on a design of Tadao ANDO was completed in March of 1994.
The construction of the open air facility based upon the design of Tadao ANDO was completed in March of 1994.
The construction of the open air facility based upon the design of Tadao ANDO was completed in March 1994.

sen.j: 以下の一覧は順に原画の題名と作者、所有者、サイズである。

The following list includes the title of the original picture, its painter's name, its owner's name and the size of the exhibited version, in this order:
